						 13 Jul 2006
Ruslan L. Davidchack <rld8@mcs.le.ac.uk>


The 3-equilibrium: the eigenvector corresponding to the -0.4 eigenvalue is 
aligned with the magnitude of the Fourier modes, not the phase.

Below are the eigenvalues for the RPOs found so far with periods up to 
70, in the format

 (rho, theta) = rho*exp(i*theta):

$\period{} = 16.3162$,
  d = 2.8638 |g| = 1.7322e-014
$(\ExpaEig_i e^{\pm i\theta_i})=

(   1.0000115535,  0.00000)
(   1.0000001509,  0.00000)

(   0.0093928475,  2.76908)

(   0.0047169023,  3.14159)

(   0.0000000000,  2.33248)
(   0.0000000000, -2.33248)

Original calculations, with errors included
> (
>  -27.03397007874626,
>    9.34426620337976,
>    1.00000000001351,
>    0.99999999999986,
>    0.99995607257578,  [error, due to associated flow]
>    0.72779991655606,  [error, due to associated flow]
>   -0.05018967056231,
>    0.00015065158255,
> )$
>
